title: xGFabric: Coupling Sensor Networks and HPC Facilities with Private 5G Wireless Networks for Real-Time Digital Agriculture
summary: This paper presents xGFabric, a system for coupling distributed sensor networks with high-performance computing facilities using private 5G wireless networks for real-time digital agriculture. It addresses the need for monitoring environmental conditions and detecting damage in citrus research facilities.
usefulness_reason: The paper discusses "distributed sensor networks" and "real-time" monitoring of "environmental conditions", which implies spatio-temporal data and a contextual dataset. While it doesn't explicitly use "point process", the nature of sensor events over space and time is relevant to the broader theme.
